Dear JESSICA CARTER:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio.
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Description supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation An internal investigation discovered that Staff 1 did not complete
any bed checks throughout her shift but documented that she did.
Investigation Administrator 1 was interviewed via phone on 3/21/2025. She
reported Staff 1 began Staff 1’s first solo 3rd shift duty on Tuesday
3/18/25. She also reported being informed by Staff 2 and Staff 3
that Youth A was missing and Staff 1 never informed Staff 2 and
Staff 3 (1st shift staff) of this situation. Staff 2 and Staff 3 also
reported to Administrator 1 that Staff 1 informed Staff 2 and Staff 3
that there were no incidents during the overnight period but when
getting Youth A up for school, Staff 2 and Staff 3 found Youth A
missing. Administrator 1 reported observing the camera footage
for the overnight shift and observing Staff 1 not completing room
checks as required. Administrator also reported Staff 1 didn’t
complete all room checks throughout the night even after Youth B
informed Staff 1 that Youth A was missing. Administrator 1
reported Youth C also informed Staff 1 that Youth A was missing
but again, Staff 1 took no action. Administrator also reported no
staff has knowledge of Youth A’s current location. Administrator
1 was interviewed again face-to-face at the facility on
3/24/2025. She reported Staff 1 has been terminated from her
employment with the facility. She also reported working on getting
a copy of the video recording of the night of the incident. She
reported the first time Staff 1 is observed on the video recording
occurred at 1 am when she was sitting in the office. She also
reported Staff 1 documented doing room checks but evidence in
the video recording shows, Staff 1 did not actually do the room
checks. She reported the sliding door in the kitchen that Youth A
used to leave the building had an alarm, but Administrator 1 found
out on 3/21/25 that the alarm was not working. She also reported
the alarm has since been fixed and 3rd shift staff were required to
sit next to the door until it was fixed over the weekend.
Administrator 1 reported Staff 1 was working alone because the
other 3rd shift staff was on maternity leave, but the facility was still
within ratio. She also reported just receiving permission from the
contractor to increase staffing so the facility will always have 2
2

staff on 3rd shift. She reported Staff 1 also failed to complete a
shift log for 3rd shift so the 1st shift staff had no information about
the prior shift.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/24/2025. She reported being the roommate of Youth A and only
found out about Youth A being gone when Youth B woke up at
3:00am. She also reported believing Youth A was in the bathroom
but didn’t find Youth A in the bathroom. She reported observing
Youth A’s suitcases earlier in the evening but observing the
suitcases were now missing. Youth B also reported speaking to
Staff 1 around 3:00am about Youth A missing and having Staff 1
say Staff 1 would contact Law Enforcement. Youth B also reported
feeling safe at the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/24/2025. She reported Youth B woke Youth C up and informed
Youth C that Youth A was missing. Youth C reported telling Youth
B that it was not Youth B’s problem and Staff 1 should call the
police. Youth C also believed because there was only one staff
member working, is what gave Youth A the opportunity to leave.
She reported feeling safe at the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/24/2025. She reported coming to work at 6:45am and finding
Youth A gone when trying to wake Youth A for school. She also
reported Staff 1 never informed Staff 2 that Youth A was missing,
and Staff 1 never completed the shift log.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/24/2025. She reported getting to work around 6:00am and never
being told by Staff 1 that Youth A was missing. She also reported
Staff 1 never completed the shift log.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 4/1/2025. She reported
being the only staff working the third shift starting at 10:00pm on
3/17/25 and ending at 6:00am on 3/18/25. She also reported not
knowing of any issue with a youth going AWOL or her room
checks. She denied missing any room checks and suggested she
did make all the required room checks during the time of her shift.
After being told of what was viewed on the video recording (see
write up of video review below), she stated “I went to every room
every 15-minutes and wrote it on the bed check log.
Youth A was never interviewed because her whereabouts were
unknown. The facility had no knowledge of Youth A’s location
3

Documents Reviewed:
Bellaview Room Checks dated 3/17/25 beginning at 10:00pm
and ending at 6:00am. This document is initialed by Staff 1.
This document outlines there were 3 youth downstairs and 6 youth
upstairs. At the 10:00pm mark it is documented 7 youth are in bed
and 2 youth are in the living room. At the next documented check
at 10:20pm it is noted all 9 youth are in bed and this check takes
place 20 minutes after the first bed check. There are 25 checks
documented that cover the period of 8 hours (should be 31 checks
if following policy). 12 of these bed checks took place 15 minutes
or less and 13 took place more than 15 minutes with the longest at
30 minutes. The check documented at 5:50 am states 6 youth in
bed with 3 in the showers. There is no documentation of a missing
youth.
3RD Shift Lead Checklist dated 3/17/25 with the Lead Staff
documented as Staff 1 and signed by Staff 1. This document
outlines the responsibilities staff are to engage in when working 3rd
shift. Within the first 30-minutes, staff are to ensure door
alarms/chimes are working, ensure all doors, entrances and
windows are locked, and document 15-minute check throughout
the entire shift. There are several other items, but these other
items involve staff checking emails and reviewing items. The top
priority throughout the shift is documented as 15-minute checks
throughout the entire shift is stated.
Email from Administrator 2 dated 3/24/25 with a subject line
of “PO approval for BV/CDS staff sharing. This document
outlines the facility’s efforts to ensure there are 2 staff on the 3rd
shift. A couple of staff are identified that can be used but are
currently working in another program. They document the need to
get these staff appropriately trained before beginning to provide
the extra help on third shift.
Bethany Christian services Refugee and Immigrant Services
Transitional Assessment Center Bellaview Policies &
Procedures dated 8/3/23. This document outlines the staff to
resident ratio. It is documented that when youth are asleep, staff
shall perform variable interval, eye-on checks of youth in a time
between the variable interval checks that shall not exceed 15-
minutes. The required staff to resident ratio is one staff for every
16-youth during overnight hours and staff are to provide variable
interval, eye-on checks for each youth not to exceed 15-minutes.
The checks are to be documented and the staff responsible shall
receive training in relation to youth safety.
4

Bethany Performance coaching form for Staff 1 dated 3/21/25.
This document outlines Staff 1 being terminated from employment
on 3/21/25 for the incident occurring on 3/17/25. The reason for
this action is documented as “employee misconduct” and this is
described as unethical, harmful, deceptive, and negligent conduct
counteracts. It is documented Staff 1 failed or neglected essential
duties, youth management, rules, procedures, and policies. It is
also documented Staff 1 falsified documentation. The facility was
notified on 3/19/25 of a youth going AWOL when Staff 1 had the
responsibility for supervision and Staff 1 did not notify other staff
or the supervisor. The outcome is documented as Staff 1’s
employment is terminated effective immediately with a last day of
3/21/25. There are no signatures on this document.
Bethany Christian Services Staff, Contractor, Volunteer code
of Conduct for Employment in Unaccompanied Children
Programs. 4.3.5 Staff Code of Conduct signed by Staff 1 on
3/6/2025. This document outlines staff’s required performance and
behavior while employed at the facility. It is noted that staff are
“continuing affirmative duty to self-disclose their own misconduct
that occurs on duty.”
Bethany Residential Youth Specialist dated 2/13/25 and
signed by Staff 1 on 3/6/25. This document outlines the job
details for staff employed as a Residential Youth Specialist. It is
documented the primary responsibility is providing care and
supervision for the youth in the program. It is further documented
the Residential Youth Specialist should follow guidelines as
outlined.
Video Review:
A video review of the beginning of the third shift (starting at
10:00 pm to 6:00 am) on 3/17/25 and ending on 3/18/25. Except
for the bathrooms and bedrooms each room is under video
surveillance. Because of this level of surveillance, Anywhere Staff
1 went was under video surveillance. There are youth on this level
and a couple of youth have bedrooms in the lower level, so Staff 1
is required to check both levels. Staff 1’s shift began at 10:00pm
and Staff 1 stayed in the office until 11:43pm when she first is
observed leaving the office and going into the kitchen. Youth A is
observed leaving her bedroom and walking down the hall to the
kitchen at 11:18pm. Then Youth A is observed leaving through the
sliding glass door in the kitchen. Staff 1 then leaves the office at
12:14am and goes into the kitchen before returning to the office.
5

At 1:04am Staff 1 leaves the office, goes to the bathroom and
returns to the office. Staff 1’s next time out of the office occurred
at 2:20am when she goes to the kitchen for water and returns to
the office. At 3:39am Youth B is observed leaving her room and
walking to the office where she appears to be speaking to Staff 1.
At 3:39am Staff 1 leaves the office goes to the kitchen then down
the hallway where she finds Youth B coming out of the bathroom
in the hallway. Staff 1 then turns around and walks back to the
office. Staff 1 leaves the office at 3:49am, goes to the kitchen
where Youth B is standing before returning to the office. Once
back in the office, Youth B and Youth C come to the office and
stands in the doorway appearing to speak to Staff 1. At 3:52am
Staff 1, Youth B, and Youth C leave the office and walk to Youth
B’s room where Staff 1 walks into the bedroom. Staff 1 then
checks each of the 4-bedrooms on this floor before walking back
to the office. Staff 1 leaves the office at 3:55am, 4:05am, 4:06am,
and 4:09am, but never goes beyond the kitchen area or bathroom.
At 4:19am, Staff 1 goes out of the front door and goes to her car.
She comes back into the office at 4:21am. Staff 1 comes back out
of the office at 5:03am and checks on the 4-bedrooms on the
same level before going back to the office at 5:06am. Staff 1 again
comes out of the office at 5:18am and checks in the 4-bedrooms
on the same level before returning to the office at 5:24am. The
last time Staff 1 leaves the office occurred at 5:44am when she
went to the kitchen and was back in the office at 5:55am. Staff 2
came to the office at 5:56am. At no time is Staff 1 observed on the
video view going downstairs to the lower level to do a room check
on the youth there. Evidence on the video recording indicates
Staff 1 only did 3-bed checks on the youth on the first level
throughout the shift from 10:00 pm to 6:00 am.
Walk-through:
A walk-through was completed at the facility. The facility is well
furnished and maintained. The bedroom of Youth A was clean and
appropriately furnished.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as evidence by interviews
with staff, youth, document reviews, and video recording review.
The facility’s policy states, staff are to complete bed checks in a
variable and interval manner no more than 15-minutes apart.
Evidence in this case indicates this did not occur and Staff 1 only
did 3-bed checks during an 8-hour period and then did not check
on all the youth in the facility.
6

TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical Assistance was offered to the facility in the idea of
supervision staff reviewing video recording of 3rd shift staff to
ensure they are following through with the appropriate supervision
of youth.
Technical Assistance was offered to the facility that they ensure
there are always two staff working 3rd shift even if a supervisor
must fill in when a staff is not available.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as evidence by interviews

Evidence indicates Staff 1 did not complete any more than 3-bed
checks and then on only part of the youth in the program. Staff 1
also documented bed checks, but the video recording does not
support she completed bed checks as she documented on the
bed check log.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical Assistance was offered to the facility around developing
an over-site process to ensure bed checks are being completed
as required.
Conclusion Violation Established

is recommended that the current license status be continued.
